December 15, 1957
INVENTORY-DIGEST OF RADIO RESEARCH
Stated broadly, this research inventory-digest has two purposes?
1. For practitioners; To provide references to, and
digests of, research which they can apply in their
professional work*
2« For researchers? To conserve effort by identifying
research related to studies researchers may be con¬
sidering*
For both groups, of course, there is the implication that keeping
up with relevant research is a professional obligation*
The end result will be a document that will includes
1* A descriptive commentary on the research findings
based on the body of s tudies selected for review,
organized to reflect the nature of the available
data*
2o An attempt to point up highlights, to draw implica¬
tions, and to suggest areas of needed research*
3* An annotated bibliography of research, including
all sources referred to plus marginal work related
to the subject or problem*
There will be some standardization of each document in the series*
At the same time, there will be enough flexibility to permit the
treatment to reflect the essential nature of the area selected*
